speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: SCENE II. Rome. The house of LEPIDUS.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and LEPIDUS

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Good Enobarbus, 'tis a worthy deed,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: And shall become you well, to entreat your captain

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: To soft and gentle speech.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I shall entreat him

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: To answer like himself: if Caesar move him,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Let Antony look over Caesar's head

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And speak as loud as Mars. By Jupiter,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Were I the wearer of Antonius' beard,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I would not shave't to-day.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: 'Tis not a time

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: For private stomaching.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Every time

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Serves for the matter that is then born in't.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: But small to greater matters must give way.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Not if the small come first.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Your speech is passion:

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: But, pray you, stir no embers up. Here comes

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: The noble Antony.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Enter MARK ANTONY and VENTIDIUS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And yonder, Caesar.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MECAENAS, and AGRIPPA

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: If we compose well here, to Parthia:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Hark, Ventidius.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I do not know,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Mecaenas; ask Agrippa.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Noble friends,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: That which combined us was most great, and let not

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: A leaner action rend us. What's amiss,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: May it be gently heard: when we debate

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Our trivial difference loud, we do commit

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Murder in healing wounds: then, noble partners,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: The rather, for I earnestly beseech,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Touch you the sourest points with sweetest terms,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Nor curstness grow to the matter.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: 'Tis spoken well.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Were we before our armies, and to fight.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I should do thus.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Flourish

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Welcome to Rome.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thank you.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Sit.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Sit, sir.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Nay, then.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I learn, you take things ill which are not so,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Or being, concern you not.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I must be laugh'd at,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: If, or for nothing or a little, I

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Should say myself offended, and with you

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Chiefly i' the world; more laugh'd at, that I should

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Once name you derogately, when to sound your name

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It not concern'd me.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: My being in Egypt, Caesar,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What was't to you?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: No more than my residing here at Rome

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Might be to you in Egypt: yet, if you there

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did practise on my state, your being in Egypt

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Might be my question.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: How intend you, practised?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You may be pleased to catch at mine intent

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: By what did here befal me. Your wife and brother

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Made wars upon me; and their contestation

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Was theme for you, you were the word of war.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: You do mistake your business; my brother never

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Did urge me in his act: I did inquire it;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And have my learning from some true reports,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That drew their swords with you. Did he not rather

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Discredit my authority with yours;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And make the wars alike against my stomach,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Having alike your cause? Of this my letters

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Before did satisfy you. If you'll patch a quarrel,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: As matter whole you have not to make it with,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: It must not be with this.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You praise yourself

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: By laying defects of judgment to me; but

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You patch'd up your excuses.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Not so, not so;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I know you could not lack, I am certain on't,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Very necessity of this thought, that I,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Your partner in the cause 'gainst which he fought,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Could not with graceful eyes attend those wars

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which fronted mine own peace. As for my wife,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I would you had her spirit in such another:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The third o' the world is yours; which with a snaffle

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: You may pace easy, but not such a wife.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Would we had all such wives, that the men might go

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: to wars with the women!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: So much uncurbable, her garboils, Caesar

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Made out of her impatience, which not wanted

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Shrewdness of policy too, I grieving grant

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Did you too much disquiet: for that you must

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: But say, I could not help it.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I wrote to you

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: When rioting in Alexandria; you

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did pocket up my letters, and with taunts

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did gibe my missive out of audience.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: He fell upon me ere admitted: then

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Three kings I had newly feasted, and did want

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of what I was i' the morning: but next day

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I told him of myself; which was as much

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: As to have ask'd him pardon. Let this fellow

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Be nothing of our strife; if we contend,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Out of our question wipe him.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You have broken

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The article of your oath; which you shall never

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Have tongue to charge me with.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Soft, Caesar!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: No,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Lepidus, let him speak:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The honour is sacred which he talks on now,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Supposing that I lack'd it. But, on, Caesar;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The article of my oath.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To lend me arms and aid when I required them;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The which you both denied.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Neglected, rather;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And then when poison'd hours had bound me up

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: From mine own knowledge. As nearly as I may,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I'll play the penitent to you: but mine honesty

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Shall not make poor my greatness, nor my power

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Work without it. Truth is, that Fulvia,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To have me out of Egypt, made wars here;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For which myself, the ignorant motive, do

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: So far ask pardon as befits mine honour

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To stoop in such a case.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: 'Tis noble spoken.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: If it might please you, to enforce no further

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: The griefs between ye: to forget them quite

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Were to remember that the present need

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Speaks to atone you.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Worthily spoken, Mecaenas.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Or, if you borrow one another's love for the

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: instant, you may, when you hear no more words of

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Pompey, return it again: you shall have time to

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: wrangle in when you have nothing else to do.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Thou art a soldier only: speak no more.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That truth should be silent I had almost forgot.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: You wrong this presence; therefore speak no more.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Go to, then; your considerate stone.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I do not much dislike the matter, but

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The manner of his speech; for't cannot be

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: We shall remain in friendship, our conditions

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: So differing in their acts. Yet if I knew

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: What hoop should hold us stanch, from edge to edge

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: O' the world I would pursue it.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Give me leave, Caesar,--

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Speak, Agrippa.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Thou hast a sister by the mother's side,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Admired Octavia: great Mark Antony

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Is now a widower.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Say not so, Agrippa:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: If Cleopatra heard you, your reproof

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Were well deserved of rashness.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I am not married, Caesar: let me hear

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Agrippa further speak.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: To hold you in perpetual amity,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: To make you brothers, and to knit your hearts

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: With an unslipping  knot, take Antony

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Octavia to his wife; whose beauty claims

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: No worse a husband than the best of men;

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Whose virtue and whose general graces speak

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: That which none else can utter. By this marriage,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: All little jealousies, which now seem great,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: And all great fears, which now import their dangers,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Would then be nothing: truths would be tales,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Where now half tales be truths: her love to both

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Would, each to other and all loves to both,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Draw after her. Pardon what I have spoke;

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: For 'tis a studied, not a present thought,

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: By duty ruminated.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Will Caesar speak?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Not till he hears how Antony is touch'd

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: With what is spoke already.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What power is in Agrippa,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: If I would say, 'Agrippa, be it so,'

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To make this good?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The power of Caesar, and

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: His power unto Octavia.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: May I never

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To this good purpose, that so fairly shows,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Dream of impediment! Let me have thy hand:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Further this act of grace: and from this hour

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The heart of brothers govern in our loves

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And sway our great designs!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: There is my hand.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: A sister I bequeath you, whom no brother

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Did ever love so dearly: let her live

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To join our kingdoms and our hearts; and never

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Fly off our loves again!

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Happily, amen!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: I did not think to draw my sword 'gainst Pompey;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For he hath laid strange courtesies and great

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of late upon me: I must thank him only,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Lest my remembrance suffer ill report;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: At heel of that, defy him.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Time calls upon's:

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Of us must Pompey presently be sought,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Or else he seeks out us.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Where lies he?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: About the mount Misenum.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: What is his strength by land?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Great and increasing: but by sea

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: He is an absolute master.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: So is the fame.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Would we had spoke together! Haste we for it:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Yet, ere we put ourselves in arms, dispatch we

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The business we have talk'd of.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: With most gladness:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And do invite you to my sister's view,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Whither straight I'll lead you.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Let us, Lepidus,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Not lack your company.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Noble Antony,

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Not sickness should detain me.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK ANTONY, and LEPIDUS

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Welcome from Egypt, sir.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Half the heart of Caesar, worthy Mecaenas! My

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: honourable friend, Agrippa!

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Good Enobarbus!

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: We have cause to be glad that matters are so well

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: digested. You stayed well by 't in Egypt.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Ay, sir; we did sleep day out of countenance, and

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: made the night light with drinking.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Eight wild-boars roasted whole at a breakfast, and

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: but twelve persons there; is this true?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: This was but as a fly by an eagle: we had much more

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: monstrous matter of feast, which worthily deserved noting.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: She's a most triumphant lady, if report be square to

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: her.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: When she first met Mark Antony, she pursed up

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: his heart, upon the river of Cydnus.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: There she appeared indeed; or my reporter devised

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: well for her.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I will tell you.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The barge she sat in, like a burnish'd throne,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Burn'd on the water: the poop was beaten gold;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Purple the sails, and so perfumed that

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The winds were love-sick with them; the oars were silver,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Which to the tune of flutes kept stroke, and made

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The water which they beat to follow faster,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: As amorous of their strokes. For her own person,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: It beggar'd all description: she did lie

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: In her pavilion--cloth-of-gold of tissue--

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: O'er-picturing that Venus where we see

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The fancy outwork nature: on each side her

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Stood pretty dimpled boys, like smiling Cupids,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: With divers-colour'd fans, whose wind did seem

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: To glow the delicate cheeks which they did cool,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And what they undid did.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: O, rare for Antony!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Her gentlewomen, like the Nereides,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: So many mermaids, tended her i' the eyes,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And made their bends adornings: at the helm

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: A seeming mermaid steers: the silken tackle

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Swell with the touches of those flower-soft hands,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That yarely frame the office. From the barge

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: A strange invisible perfume hits the sense

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Of the adjacent wharfs. The city cast

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Her people out upon her; and Antony,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enthroned i' the market-place, did sit alone,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Whistling to the air; which, but for vacancy,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Had gone to gaze on Cleopatra too,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And made a gap in nature.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Rare Egyptian!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Upon her landing, Antony sent to her,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Invited her to supper: she replied,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: It should be better he became her guest;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Which she entreated: our courteous Antony,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Whom ne'er the word of 'No' woman heard speak,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Being barber'd ten times o'er, goes to the feast,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And for his ordinary pays his heart

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: For what his eyes eat only.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Royal wench!

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: She made great Caesar lay his sword to bed:

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: He plough'd her, and she cropp'd.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I saw her once

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Hop forty paces through the public street;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And having lost her breath, she spoke, and panted,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That she did make defect perfection,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And, breathless, power breathe forth.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Now Antony must leave her utterly.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Never; he will not:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Age cannot wither her, nor custom stale

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Her infinite variety: other women cloy

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The appetites they feed: but she makes hungry

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Where most she satisfies; for vilest things

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Become themselves in her: that the holy priests

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Bless her when she is riggish.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: If beauty, wisdom, modesty, can settle

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: The heart of Antony, Octavia is

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: A blessed lottery to him.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Let us go.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Good Enobarbus, make yourself my guest

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Whilst you abide here.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Humbly, sir, I thank you.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Exeunt
